TopicTitle: Help on a Eve Return Lander design

Articles.Content:
Ok, I'm designing a Return Lander that is capable of both landing and return from Eve, and after stupidly posted a question type forum (whatever it's called) (and got help from fellow fliers) I decided to just make a new topic type (again, whatever it's called) forum, to ask for help from you guys.

I took some advice from said fliers (if that is a proper title) and currently decreasing the mass of my ship (which testing is troublesome but luckily I have the almighty HyperEdit).

Again, I appreciate the help given by the guys who gave advice and help in my previous question typ- whatever!

Here is the link if you also have the same trouble and wanted to see more advice: My Previous QTF (Question Type Forum)

PS: Does anyone knows a TWR calculator around here? 

PPS: Cookies and snacks for everyone here.

Edited December 5, 2015 by Red Iron Crown
Forgot to type in "testing" on second paragraph
I'd install either the KER and/or Mechjeb mods. Both have very good dynamic dV calculators.
You really, really need KER to look at what's going on in Eve's atmosphere in the VAB.  The MJ readout isn't as flexible or obvious.

Downloaded KER, despite my tortoise internet.

Also, my lander is too heavy for just five spikes to lift it, any ideas?

Not surprised, as the spike doesn't have top thrust-to-weight ratio on Eve (or anywhere for that matter).  You can have a try with more spikes (1.25m core stage surrounded by 6x 1.25m boosters).  You'll probably find a design with two layers of asparagused boosters (i.e 13 spikes) that lifts OK.  

Or for a less maddening design, look at using a Vector or four as first-stage engines.  If they can get you to 20km, a single spike should be able to get a simple pod to orbit from there.

I think I put this on your other thread, might as well here too:
